business.headline: Adani Group gets clean chit from Sebi over Hindenburg claimsHindenburg Research had alleged that four Adani group companies lent Rs 6.2 billion ($87.4 million) in 2020, without properly disclosing it in financial statements.
Can you own a credit card without a bank account? Find outYou don't always need a savings account to apply for a credit card; new digital options are changing the rules. Have a look.

Are Fed rate cut and tariff relief setting up a market rally?A softer stance from the US Federal Reserve and the possibility of reduced reciprocal tariffs have lifted investor mood. The big question now: are these triggers enough to set off a sustained rally in Indian markets?

Sensex, Nifty extend rally on US-India trade talk optimismThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 318.97 points to finish at 83,012.68, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 93.35 points to settle at 25,423.60. Broader markets, however, displayed mixed momentum, with several indices ending weaker as profit-booking set in.

US may scrap 25% penal duty on India, cut reciprocal tariffs to 10–15%: CEAChief Economic Adviser V. Anantha Nageswaran indicated that the US reciprocal tariff on Indian goods, currently at 25%, may be reduced to 10–15%.

Missed your ITR deadline? 3 filing options you can still useIf you missed the Income Tax Return (ITR) deadline, don't panic. Taxpayers still have ways to stay compliant and avoid penalties, with three key filing options available even after the due date.

Want to get a loan this festive season? Here's what you can doFrom new clothes and jewellery to family trips and home makeovers, festivals often come with added costs. A personal loan can help bridge the gap, here's a simple guide to getting one this festive season.

iValue Infosolutions IPO opens: Should you consider subscribing?iValue Infosolutions plans to Rs 560 crore through an offer-for-sale of 1.87 crore shares. The price band is set at Rs 284–299 per share, with a minimum investment of 50 shares.

ITR refund 2025: How long will it take to reach you?Millions of taxpayers who filed their returns by the September 16 deadline are now waiting for the next big step, i.e., getting their refunds. But how long does it actually take for the money to land in your bank account?

Why gold loans are no longer just a last resort for borrowersGold loans are shedding their emergency-only image, becoming a mainstream credit choice for urban, semi-urban, and rural India, driven by gold prices, regulation, digital access, and flexible borrowing solutions.

Should investors buy IT stocks right now? Here's what Ventura Securities saysVentura Securities warns of a shift, with US-driven risks mounting, domestic sectors like banking and NBFCs offer a safer path, leaving IT investors to weigh growth against growing uncertainty.

Sensex, Nifty rise on US Fed rate cut; Infosys, Wipro gainThe S&P BSE Sensex gained over 350 points to trade above the 83,000 mark, while the NSE Nifty50 crossed 25,400 in early trade. Broader market indices also saw gains, with volatility remaining stable.

entertainment.headline: Deepika Padukone quit Kalki 2 after her role was reduced to a cameo: SourceDeepika Padukone exited 'Kalki 2898 AD's sequel after her role was reduced significantly. On September 18, the makers, in an X post, wrote that a project like 'Kalki' requires a certain level of commitment and announced that they had parted ways with her.

OG fever: How Pawan Kalyan's film created real buzz in era of fake hypeFrom a viral teaser to stylish stunts and Thaman's music, 'They Call Him OG' has created genuine excitement that goes beyond fan hype, positioning Pawan Kalyan for a big-screen comeback this September 25.

The Trial Season 2 review: Kajol's legal drama settles out of courtroomRelease Date:Fri Sep 19, 2025The Trial Season 2 series review: The Trial Season 2, starring Kajol, attempts to continue the courtroom drama but largely avoids intense legal battles, focusing more on emotional and political conflicts. The series is currently streaming on JioHotstar.

BIFF Day 2: Huma's Bayaan, Park Chan-wook's thriller and candid conversationsDay 2 of BIFF 2025 blended star-studded appearances, film premieres, and inclusive community initiatives, reinforcing its status as Asia's premier cinema festival.
Rajnikanth's daughter Soundarya calls him Powerhouse Appa after Coolie successSoundaryaa Rajinikanth praised her father as 'Powerhouse Appa' as 'Coolie' trended in Amazon Prime's global top 10.

Actor Robo Shankar, 46, dies day after on-set collapse. Kamal Haasan pays tributeTamil actor Robo Shankar died at a private hospital in Chennai on September 18, a day after collapsing on set. Kamal Haasan shared a heartfelt tribute on X.

Luca Guadagnino backs his MeToo-themed After the Hunt amid anti-feminist criticismDirector Luca Guadagnino responded to anti-feminist criticism of his MeToo-themed film 'After the Hunt'. He urged viewers to appreciate the powerful female characters and enjoy the story without generic labels.

Mahavatar Narsimha OTT release: When and where to watch the animation blockbusterDirector Ashwin Kumar's animated film 'Mahavatar Narsimha' is all set for its OTT release. The mystical action-drama based on ancient texts was released in theatres on July 25, 2025.

Himani Shivpuri recalls when superstitious Govinda refused to board a flightActor Himani Shivpuri opened up about Govinda's shifting work habits and belief in mahurats. She added how such beliefs have led to delays and confusion on various film sets.

Vrusshabha teaser: Mohanlal transforms into a fierce warrior in this period dramaThe wait is finally over. After treating fans with the first-look poster, Mohanlal unveiled the teaser of his upcoming film, 'Vrusshabha.'  The film marks the veteran actor's third foray into the period action genre in recent years.

Varun Dhawan gets trolled for interrupting Janhvi Kapoor's AI remark: DisrespectfulAt the trailer launch of 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari', Janhvi Kapoor spoke about the misuse of AI-generated images, but Varun Dhawan interrupted her with a joke, sparking backlash online. Social media users criticised Varun for being "disrespectful" and diverting attention from a serious issue.

Urmila Matondkar's birthday wish for Shabana Azmi has nostalgic Masoom throwbackOn Shabana Azmi's birthday, actor Urmila Matondkar shared a heartfelt note and nostalgic photos from her debut film 'Masoom', recalling their decades-long bond. Urmila praised Azmi for inspiring her both on and off-screen, calling her "Queen" at 75.

Who is Jimmy Kimmel? TV host faces suspension after controversial remarks on Charlie KirkABC has stopped airing 'Jimmy Kimmel Live!' after the host made "offensive" remarks about the death of conservative leader Charlie Kirk. The show has been taken off-air indefinitely, ending Kimmel's long late-night run for the time being.

The Ba***ds of Bollywood review: It's Aryan's love letter to the filmy chaos, dramaRelease Date:Thu Sep 18, 2025Aryan Khan's directorial debut, 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' premiered on September 18. The show isn't about exposing Bollywood, it's about embracing its madness. With wit, cameos, and chaos, the Netflix show is messy, filmy, and oh-so-fun.

Huma Qureshi wins Face of Asia Award in Busan, dedicates it to women dreamersActor Huma Qureshi was presented the Face of Asia Award at the Busan International Film Festival (BIFF). She dedicated her win to young girls who dared to dream.

Bollywood's big deja vu: Same stories, new faces, zero shameBollywood keeps serving recycled plots driven by glamour and hype. Here's exploring why stories are missing in today's big-budget films and what audiences really want.

Ed Sheeran confirms collaboration with Karan Aujla, song to be out in OctoberBritish singer Ed Sheeran confirmed his collaboration with Punjabi singer Karan Aujla. He shared that the song, which was shot in New York, will be out in October.

Team Jeremiah vs Team Conrad: Who really won in The Summer I Turned Pretty?A deep dive into 'The Summer I Turned Pretty's ultimate love triangle. Team Jeremiah vs Team Conrad - who really won, who should have, and why fans are still fighting about it.

Amaal Mallik alleges Anu Malik betrayed his father, recalls mother being mistreatedSinger-composer Amaal Mallik shared the struggles and hardships his parents underwent on 'Bigg Boss 19'. He blamed his uncle Anu Malik for betraying his father and also recalled how his mother was taunted by Daboo Malik's family.

general news.headline: Telangana techie shot dead by US cops, family seeks help to bring back bodyTelangana techie Mohammed Nizamuddin was shot dead by Santa Clara police after allegedly stabbing his roommate. His family disputes details, seeks repatriation, while US police cite self-defence and recovered knives.

I am very close to India and Modi: Trump after repeated rant over Russia oil tradeUS President Donald Trump, while addressing reporters during his UK visit, said that he is very close to India and Prime Minister Narendra Modi. His remarks come after his repeated rants over India's Russian oil trade.

US revokes sanctions waiver for India, other countries at Iran's Chabahar portThe waiver had allowed India and other countries to continue work on the port without facing US penalties. The US has now revoked the sanction exemption, and it will come into effect from September 29.

What went wrong for Neeraj Chopra in World Championships finalWorld Athletics Championships 2025: Neeraj Chopra admitted he was not in peak physical condition ahead of his title defence, revealing that he suffered a back injury while training in the Czech Republic earlier this month.

In pics: New flyover in Nagpur cuts through house's balconyThe flyover in question is part of the Indora-Dighori corridor in Nagpur's Ashok Nagar area, currently being developed by the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI).

UP man's number shown at Rahul Gandhi press meet. He gets bombarded with callsAnjani Mishra, who lives in Prayagraj, said he was surprised to see his number mentioned by Rahul Gandhi at the September 18 press briefing. He complained that he was getting a barrage of calls after his number was shown.

Least bothered: DK Shivakumar shrugs off threats by firms to exit BengaluruKarnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar hit back at criticism over Bengaluru's infrastructure, dismissing threats of companies leaving the city while accusing Union Minister HD Kumaraswamy of political posturing with pothole remarks.

US tariff threats against India won't work, says Lavrov as Trump softens rhetoricLavrov's comments come amid months of repeated warnings from US President Donald Trump, who has criticised India's oil trade with Russia and threatened tariffs. In recent weeks, Trump has taken a noticeably softer approach towards India despite his rhetoric.

The Trial Season 2 review: Kajol's legal drama settles out of courtroomRelease Date:Fri Sep 19, 2025The Trial Season 2 series review: The Trial Season 2, starring Kajol, attempts to continue the courtroom drama but largely avoids intense legal battles, focusing more on emotional and political conflicts. The series is currently streaming on JioHotstar.
The 80% gap: Why most Indians are underinsured and why it's time to actThe solution lies in choosing a comprehensive life cover that reflects modern realities.

University of Bath School of Management: Where Careers Begin With ConfidenceWith students from over 160 countries and a strong alumni network spanning 130 nations, the School creates a community that feels global in reach yet personal in experience.

ICC weighs action against PCB for filming meeting with referee in restricted areaAsia Cup: The International Cricket Committee is considering action against Pakistan for violation of multiple rules, including filming of restricted areas, before their match against the UAE on Wednesday. Pakistan released a video of their team's discussion with match referee Andy Pycroft, claiming he apologised for miscommunication during the handshake snub on Sunday.

Deepika Padukone quit Kalki 2 after her role was reduced to a cameo: SourceDeepika Padukone exited 'Kalki 2898 AD's sequel after her role was reduced significantly. On September 18, the makers, in an X post, wrote that a project like 'Kalki' requires a certain level of commitment and announced that they had parted ways with her.

Asia Cup: India eye clinical show against Oman before rematch vs PakistanHaving sealed their spot in the Super 4 stages, India might look to test their bench strength in the last group fixture against Oman. The match will also serve as an opportunity to fine-tune their preparations ahead of another blockbuster clash against arch-rivals Pakistan in the Super 4.

Armed assailants fire 25-30 rounds on builder's office in GurugramAccording to initial reports, the five attackers on Thursday night opened fire indiscriminately inside the MNR Buildmark office, targeting vehicles parked inside and leaving visible bullet marks throughout the premises.

France's Macron to offer scientific proof in US court to prove his wife is a womanFrench President Emmanuel Macron and wife Brigitte plan to present evidence in a US court to counter transgender claims. Owens has repeatedly alleged that Brigitte Macron was born male and transitioned before marrying Emmanuel Macron.

Afghanistan see Asia Cup early exit as pause, not halt, in T20 surgeAfghanistan got knocked out of the Asia Cup 2025 after their six-wicket loss against Sri Lanka in their last Group B fixture in Abu Dhabi. The Rashid Khan-led side was touted as the second-best team of the tournament after India but failed to live up to the expectations.

Actor Robo Shankar, 46, dies day after on-set collapse. Kamal Haasan pays tributeTamil actor Robo Shankar died at a private hospital in Chennai on September 18, a day after collapsing on set. Kamal Haasan shared a heartfelt tribute on X.

Disha Patani home firing: Gangster Rohit Godara vows revenge after shooters killedThe two shooters, identified as Ravindra alias Kallu and Arun, were active members of the Rohit Godara–Goldy Brar gang and wanted in multiple criminal cases.

Dramatic fall caught on CCTV: 25-year-old slips from balcony in JodhpurA 25-year-old man, Nazir, fell from a second-floor balcony in Jodhpur while at work, sustaining serious injuries. The CCTV footage has gone viral now.

Watch: Dejected Neeraj Chopra sits in silence after World Championships setbackNeeraj Chopra sat dejected and silent in the dugout after finishing eighth in the men's javelin final at the World Championships 2025 in Tokyo. The result ended his remarkable seven-year medal streak.

UK deports Indian migrant to Paris in first case under new UK-France treatyAn Indian migrant was deported to France under a new UK-France treaty. Home Secretary Shabana Mahmood called it an "important first step" in curbing Channel crossings by people smugglers.

Kimmel said horrible thing about Charlie Kirk, says Trump as show pulled off airABC suspended 'Jimmy Kimmel Live!' indefinitely after Nexstar Communications Group, which operates about two dozen ABC-affiliated stations, refused to air the programme. The decision followed criticism of Kimmel's remarks about Charlie Kirk.

Magnitude 7.8 earthquake hits Russia's Kamchatka, no damage reportedA magnitude 7.8 earthquake struck the Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky region, Russia, during the early hours of Friday, September 19. The U.S. Geological Survey said the quake was measured at a magnitude of 7.8 and at a depth of 10 km (6.2 miles). It said a series of aftershocks followed, measuring up to 5.8.

sports.headline: Noah Lyles targets Usain Bolt's record after fastest-ever 200m semifinalWorld Athletics Championships: Noah Lyles set a blistering 19.51 seconds to qualify for the 200m final at Tokyo. He promised a magical final as he aims to win his fourth successive gold medal in the event in the world meet.

The match will also serve as an opportunity to fine-tune their preparations ahead of another blockbuster clash against arch-rivals Pakistan in the Super 4.

The Rashid Khan-led side was touted as the second-best team of the tournament after India but failed to live up to the expectations.

India predicted XI for Asia Cup clash vs Oman: Will Jasprit Bumrah be rested?Asia Cup, India predicted XI for Oman clash: India are unlikely to make changes for their final Asia Cup group game against Oman, apart from possibly resting their pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah.

Sri Lanka cricketer learns of father's death after Asia Cup matchSri Lanka spinner Dunith Wellalage was informed of his father Suranga's death after the team's Asia Cup match against Afghanistan in Abu Dhabi. Suranga, who also played cricket, captained one of Sri Lanka's leading school sides, according to former all-rounder Russell Arnold.

Asia Cup: Sri Lanka knock Afghanistan out, take Bangladesh into Super 4Asia Cup 2025: Kusal Mendis struck an unbeaten 74 off 52 balls to power Sri Lanka to a six-wicket win over Afghanistan in their final group match, securing a place in the Asia Cup Super Four alongside Bangladesh on Thursday.

Watch: Mohammad Nabi smashes 5 consecutive sixes against Wellalage in Asia CupMohammad Nabi unleashed a stunning display by hitting five consecutive sixes against Sri Lanka in the Asia Cup 2025. He brought up his half-century off just 20 balls, the joint fastest by an Afghanistan batter.

Asia Cup: Kuldeep Yadav reveals his success mantra against PakistanIndia spinner Kuldeep Yadav remains unfazed by the noise surrounding the controversy ahead of the high-voltage Asia Cup Super 4 clash against Pakistan. The left-arm wrist-spinner also outlined his success mantra, saying he treats every batter the same, regardless of the opposition.

ICC weighs action against PCB for filming meeting with referee in restricted areaAsia Cup: The International Cricket Committee is considering action against Pakistan for violation of multiple rules, including filming of restricted areas, before their match against the UAE on Wednesday. Pakistan released a video of their team's discussion with match referee Andy Pycroft, claiming he apologised for miscommunication during the handshake snub on Sunday.

In rainy Tokyo, Sydney McLaughlin runs fastest time in 40 years to win 400 mWorld Athletics Championships: Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone, who broke the world record to win Olympic gold over the hurdles last year, made the switch to the flat this season, came up with a sensational race on a rain evening in Tokyo to win the gold in women's 400m.

The left-arm wrist-spinner also outlined his success mantra, saying he treats every batter the same, regardless of the opposition.

Pakistan released a video of their team's discussion with match referee Andy Pycroft, claiming he apologised for miscommunication during the handshake snub on Sunday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
